questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding shallow and deep wells?

choices.text: Shallow wells tap water from underneath the first impervious layer and are not liable for contamination.
Deep wells yield limited quantities of water and usually dry up during summer.
Shallow wells are more likely to get contaminated and yield limited quantities of water.
Deep wells are easier and cheaper to construct compared to shallow wells.

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: C) Shallow wells are more likely to get contaminated and yield limited quantities of water.

Explanation:

Shallow wells tap water from above the first impervious layer, making them more susceptible to contamination and often yield limited quantities of water.
In contrast, deep wells tap water from underneath the first impervious layer, providing purer water in sufficient quantities and a constant supply, even during summer.

Porous layer: made of sand, gravel and allows water to pass through it.
Impervious layer: made of clay, mud and does not allow water to pass through it.

questions.text: You are required to disinfect a well using Horrock’s apparatus. The well has a diameter of 1.5 meters and a depth of 10 meters. Considering 2 grams of bleaching powder (calcium hypochlorite) is needed per cubic meter of water for effective disinfection, how much bleaching powder is required to disinfect this well?

choices.text: 28 grams
35 grams
42 grams
50 grams

questions.solution:
Correct Answer B) 35 grams

Explanation

1. Calculate the volume of the well:

  • Volume of a cylinder = π × radius² × height (or) V= π x (diameter/2)² x height
  • Radius = Diameter / 2 = 1.5 meters / 2 = 0.75 meters
  • Height = Depth of the well = 10 meters

Volume = π × (0.75 meters)² × 10 meters

→ Volume ≈ 3.14 × 0.5625 × 10

→ Volume ≈ 17.67 cubic meters

2. Calculate the amount of bleaching powder needed:

  • Bleaching powder required = Volume of the well × Amount of bleaching powder per cubic meter

⇒ 17.67 cubic meters × 2 grams per cubic meter

  • Bleaching powder required ≈ 35.33 grams

Rounding off, the required amount of bleaching powder is approximately 35 grams.

questions.text: Which of the following diseases is primarily classified as a water-washed disease?

choices.text: Cholera
Dracunculiasis (Guinea worm disease)
Trachoma
Malaria

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: C) Trachoma

Explanation:

Water Washed disease also known as Water scarcity disease is associated with inadequate amount of water to maintain personal hygiene. Examples include trachoma, scabies, conjunctivitis, worm infestations.

Type of Disease Definition/Transmission Examples
Water Borne Caused by ingestion of pathogens in contaminated water. Cholera, Typhoid, Diarrhea, Hepatitis A and E, GI infections, Polio.
Water Washed Due to lack of clean water for washing, leading to poor hygiene and sanitation. Infective trachoma, Scabies, Conjunctivitis, Bacillary Amoebic dysentery, Worm infestations.
Water Based Due to the intermediate host in water - Contact with or ingestion of water containing the organisms. Dracunculiasis (Guinea worm disease), Schistosomiasis
Water related/Breeding Diseases that are transmitted by vectors which breed in or near water such as mosquitoes. Malaria, Dengue fever, Japanese Encephalitis, Chikungunya.

questions.text: Which of the following microbiological tests is considered confirmatory evidence for recent fecal contamination of water?

choices.text: Total Coliform Test
Fecal streptococci
Clostridium perfringens Test
Heterotrophic Plate Count

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: B) Fecal streptococci

Explanation

Fecal streptococci are considered as the confirmatory evidence for recent fecal contamination of water.

Drinking water should be free from pathogenic microorganisms and fecal contamination. There are bacterial indicators that suggest fecal contamination of water.

These are

  • Coliform bacteria - includes both fecal and nonfecal organisms. The most common fecal organism is E.coli - the most reliable evidence of fecal contamination
  • Fecal streptococci - confirmatory evidence for recent fecal contamination

Clostridium perfringens - evidence of remote fecal contamination.

Purpose: Isolating and quantifying bacteria in a water sample.

questions.text:
Which of the following statements is true ?

 

A) E. Coli can produce stable acids like lactic acid from glucose

B) Indole production is a characteristic E. coli

C) E. coli can use citrate as its source of carbon

D) Presumptive Coliforms test is a confirmatory test for Ecoli detection in water

E) E .COLI Is the most reliable evidence for fecal contamination of water

choices.text: A,B,C
A,B,D
B,C,D,E
A,B,C,E

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: D) A,B,C,E

Explanation:

E. Coli confirmatory test (EIC test)

Description

Eijkman test

Detects the production of stable acids (such as lactic acid) from glucose fermentation. Methyl red indicator doesn’t change color in acid medium (Statement A)

Indole production

Indole production is a characteristic E. coli from Tryptophan. A positive result is indicated by a cherry red color in addition to Kovac's reagent.(Statement B)

Citrate Utilization

A positive result is indicated by a change in the color of the medium from green to blue, suggesting that E. coli has utilized citrate (Statement C)

 

Presumptive Coliform Test is a screening test for presence of E. Coli in potable water. (Statement D)

questions.text: John & his 10-year-old son set off on a camping trip to a remote area for its beautiful streams and scenic views. They spot a river flowing with clear water however John warns his son to not drink from it directly and rather purify it first. Which of the following statements is true regarding the purification of water on a small scale?

choices.text: Boiling water is preferred over chlorination because it is cost-effective and provides long-term residual activity.
Boiling is not preferred as a mode of water purification because it requires re-treatment every 4-6 hours.
Chlorination is less effective than boiling because it lacks residual activity and requires frequent re-treatment.
Water should be turbid for chlorination to effectively take place.

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: B) Boiling is not preferred as a mode of water purification because it requires re-treatment every 4-6 hours.

 

Explanation:

This statement is true because boiling water is

  • Costly as it consumes a lot of gas.
  • It requires boiling water every 4-6 hours (re-treatment).
  • Therefore it has no residual activity.
  • Hence it is not the preferred method of purification.
  • Boiling water is costly and provides no residual activity, hence it is not preferred over chlorine.
  • However, it is still the best method available for purification. (Option A)

Chlorine is a more effective mode of water purification than boiling due to (Option C):

  • It has high residual activity and does not require frequent re-treatment of water.
  • This residual activity is also known as Free chlorine.
  • This makes it very cost-effective as well.
  • The most commonly used form of chlorination is bleaching powder
  • 100g of bleaching powder releases 33 grams of chlorine.
  • However, it is the 2nd best method available for water purification on a small scale. 
  • For water to be chlorinated, water should be free from turbidity as turbidity impedes efficient chlorination. (Option D)

questions.text: Which statement best describes the disinfecting property of chlorine when used in water purification?

choices.text: The major disinfecting property of chlorine is due to the hypochlorite ion (OCl-).
The residual activity of chlorine, known as free chlorine, is mainly due to hydrogen chloride (HCI) in water.
Chlorination is the primary method for water purification due to its ability to kill all types of microorganisms without altering taste and smell.
The disinfecting property of chlorine is primarily due to hypochlorous acid (HOCl).

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: D) The disinfecting property of chlorine is primarily due to hypochlorous acid (HOCl), which accounts for 90% of its disinfecting action.

Explanation:

This is true because:

Disinfecting property of chlorine- 90% is due to HOCl (Hypochlorous acid) and 10% due to OCl- (Hypochlorite ion).

Hence, the Major disinfecting property of chlorine is due to Hypochlorous acid.

  • The major disinfecting property is due to the HOCl (90%) and not OCl- (10%). (Option A)
  • HCl gets neutralized by the alkalinity of water and has no role to play in the disinfection. (Option B)
  • Boiling is considered to be the best method of water purification as it kills spores, ova, cyclops, and other resistant microorganisms. Also, to kill Poliovirus/Cyclops, the dose of chlorine needs to be increased, leading to an alteration in the taste and smell of water. (Option C)

questions.text: All of the following are true regarding the components of the above-given apparatus except:

choices.text: It contains 1 black cup and 6 white cups.
The 6 white cups are of 200ml capacity each
The indicator used in this is starch iodide.
It has 1 glass stirring rod

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: D) It has 1 glass stirring rod.

Explanation:

The image given is that of Horrocks apparatus.

It is an apparatus used to estimate the chlorine demand of water (or the dose of

Bleaching powder that is required for disinfecting water).

Contents of the apparatus

  • 1 black cup
  • 6 white white cups (200 ml capacity each)
  • 2 metal spoons
  • 7 glass stirring rods
  • 1 special pipette
  • Starch-iodide solution
  • 2 droppers

Procedure:

  • A stock solution is made by mixing 2g (1 spoonful) of bleaching powder with water in the black cup and filling up to the brim.
  • The 6 white cups are to be filled with water to be disinfected up to about a cm below the brim.
  • With a special pipette provided, 1 drop of stock solution is added to the 1st cup, 2 drops to the 2nd, 3 drops to the 3rd cup, and so on.
  • Water is stirred in each cup using a SEPARATE glass rod.
  • After 30 minutes, 3 drops of the indicator are added to each white cup and stirred again.

Interpretation: The first cup that shows a blue colour will tell us how much bleaching powder is required. (n*2) where n = first cup which shows the blue colour change.
n× 2 is the amount of bleaching powder required to disinfect 455 litres of water.

Hence 7 separate glass rods are necessary for performing this method correctly, not 1.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding the OT and OTA tests used for chlorination of water?

choices.text: The OT test can detect both free and combined chlorine separately, making it superior to the OTA test.
Breakpoint chlorination is achieved when the chlorine demand of water is exceeded, resulting in free or residual chlorine that keeps the water disinfected.
The OTA test is unable to detect combined chlorine separately and is affected by interfering substances such as nitrates, iron, and manganese.
The OT test can detect free chlorine but not combined chlorine, while the OTA test can detect both free and combined chlorine separately and is not affected by interfering substances.

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: D) The OT test can detect free chlorine but not combined chlorine, while the OTA test can detect both free and combined chlorine separately and is not affected by interfering substances.

Explanation:

This statement accurately describes the capabilities of both tests.

  • The OT (Ortho Toluidine) test can detect free chlorine but does not separately measure combined chlorine. Combined chlorine ( i.e chlorine demand of water measured by Horrocks apparatus) + free/ residual chlorine( 0.5 mg/dl for drinking water) = total amount of chlorine in the water. 
  • Combined chlorine by OT test is measured indirectly as: Total chlorine - free chlorine = combined chlorine
  • The OTA (Ortho Toluidine Arsenite) test, however, can detect both free and combined chlorine separately and is not influenced by substances such as nitrates, iron, and manganese, making it a more robust and precise method for water chlorination testing.

The OT test can detect free chlorine but does not combine chlorine separately. On the other hand, the OTA test can detect both free and combined chlorine separately, making it superior to the OT test in this regard. (Option A)

The statement is only partially correct. Breakpoint chlorination is the point at which the chlorine demand of water is met and NOT exceeded. (Option B)

  • When the chlorine demand of water is met, any additional chlorine added remains as free or residual chlorine, which ensures continuous disinfection.

The OTA test is designed to detect both free and combined chlorine separately. Additionally, it is not affected by interfering substances like nitrates, iron, and manganese, making it more reliable in various conditions compared to the OT test. (Option C)

questions.text:
Near your home, there is an overhead water tank that needs disinfection. The sanitation officer decides to prepare a solution using high-test hypochlorite.

Which of the following is true regarding high-test hypochlorite?

choices.text: A single tablet of 0.5 g is sufficient to disinfect 20 liters of water.
It contains 60-70% available chlorine.
It is available as Nesfield's and Bursoline's tablets.
It is no longer recommended for water disinfection.

questions.solution:
Correct Answer: B) It contains 60-70% available chlorine

Explanation:

  • High-Test Hypochlorite(HTH) or Perchloron is a calcium compound that contains 60-70% of available chlorine.
  • It is more stable than bleaching powder and deteriorates much less in storage
  • Solutions prepared from HTH are also used for water disinfection.

A single Chlorine (not HTH) tablet of 0.5g is sufficient to disinfect 20 liters of water. (Option A)

Nesfield's and Bursoline's tablets are Iodine tablets (Option C)

  • Iodine is used for emergency disinfection of water. 2 drops of 2% ethanol solution of iodine will suffice for one liter of clear water, contact time of 20-30 min.

HTH is still recommended for water disinfection (Option D)

  • Rather, Potassium permanganate, a powerful oxidizing agent, once widely used for disinfection, is now no longer recommended.
